text: To expand our business operations, we are exploring inorganic growth opportunities through selective strategic joint ventures and acquisitions that expand our opportunities in other end-markets, geographic regions, new customers and new products or enhance our technological capabilities. For example, we have recently entered into a binding term sheet dated September 16, 2025 for establishment of a joint venture with a Spanish company to manufacture advanced cable monitoring systems and associated products

In particular, we intend to explore inorganic growth opportunities across two key areas of the power sector: the line vertical, which includes conductors and cables, and the equipment vertical, which encompasses substation equipment such as transformers and switchgears. Our industry experience and insights enables us to identify suitable target companies for acquisition and effectively evaluate and execute potential opportunities. We will maintain our disciplined approach to acquisitions which involves consideration of various selection criterias such as growth and earnings potential, skills of the management team, operation scale, technological profile and capabilities, product portfolio maturity, customer base, end-market exposures, valuation and estimated costs, as well as cultural fit.
The strategies described above have been approved by a resolution passed by our Board at its meeting held on September 29, 2025.

We manufacture and supply a wide range of overhead conductors, power cables, optical ground wire to customers, including central and state transmission utility companies, global utilities, EPC companies, renewables and transmission developers, metro products and industrial sector comprising data centers, steel, oil and gas, and cement in India and internationally.
We manufacture a wide range of overhead conductors, the details of some of our key products are as follows:

Overhead Conductors
1.All Aluminium Alloy Conductors ("AAAC")It has several layers of aluminium alloy (generally Al-Mg-Si) stranded in concentric layers. Designed using a high strength aluminium - Magnesium - Silicon Alloy to achieve a high strength-to-weight ratio; affords optimum sag-tension characteristics, and corrosion resistance when compared with ACSR.
2.All Aluminium Conductors ("AAC")It is also known as aluminium stranded conductor. It consists of several layers of aluminium wires stranded of hard drawn 1350 aluminum concentrically. AAC conductors are manufactured from electrolytically refined aluminium with a minimum purity of 99.7% and are used in low, medium and high voltage overhead lines.
3.Aluminium Alloy ("ACAR") Conductor reinforcedIt is formed by concentrically stranded wires of Aluminium 1350 and high strength Aluminium-Magnesium-Silicon ("AIMgSi") alloy core. The number of wires of each depends on the cable design. The typical design comprises a stranded core of AIMgSi alloy strands but in certain cable constructions, the wires of AIMgSi alloy strands can be in layers throughout the Aluminium 1350 strands.
